item.title: The Thousand-Year-Old Girl
item.description: The concept of living forever jumps out at people uncomfortable with their own existence. There is a contemplative instinct among educated people that â€” if they could simply will themselves into a state of self-actualisation â€” death would only be an obstacle to greatness. As Tzipora found out quickly, the opposite was true â€” death and temporality were wells of meaning against which all great people, beauty, and human constructions were cast.
